含义: The character '扮' means 'to dress up', 'to disguise', or 'to play a role'. It is often used in contexts related to acting, costumes, or pretending.
字形: The character '扮' is composed of two parts: the left radical '扌' (hand radical) and the right component '分' (meaning 'to divide' or 'to separate'). Together, they suggest the idea of using hands to change or divide one's appearance.
读音: The pronunciation of '扮' is 'bàn' in Mandarin Chinese.
字源: The character '扮' originates from the combination of the hand radical '扌' and the phonetic component '分'. Historically, it has been associated with the act of changing one's appearance or role.
含此字的字: Characters that contain '扮' include '扮' itself, as it is not commonly used as a component in other characters.
同音字: Some homophone characters for '扮' include '办' (to handle), '半' (half), and '伴' (companion).
常用词组: 扮演 (bànyǎn) - to play a role
假扮 (jiǎbàn) - to pretend, to disguise
成语: 乔装打扮 (qiáozhuāng dǎbàn) - to disguise oneself
粉墨登场 (fěnmò dēngchǎng) - to make one's debut on stage (often with elaborate makeup)
例句: 他在剧中扮演了一个英雄角色。 (Tā zài jù zhōng bànyǎnle yīgè yīngxióng juésè.) - He played the role of a hero in the play.
她喜欢在万圣节时装扮成各种角色。 (Tā xǐhuān zài wànshèngjié shí zhuāngbàn chéng gè zhǒng juésè.) - She likes to dress up as various characters during Halloween.
短故事: Once, a famous actor was asked to play the role of a beggar in a play. To prepare, he spent days living on the streets, dressing in rags, and observing the behavior of real beggars. His dedication to '扮' (playing the role) was so intense that even his fellow actors couldn't recognize him on the day of the performance.
